import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F
import numpy as np

# 1. åŸºç¡€å®ç°
def leaky_relu(x, alpha=0.01):
    return np.where(x > 0, x, alpha * x)

# 2. PyTorchå®ç°
x = torch.tensor([-2.0, -1.0, 0.0, 1.0, 2.0])
leaky_output = F.leaky_relu(x, negative_slope=0.01)
print(f"Leaky ReLUè¾“å‡º: {leaky_output}")

# 3. åœ¨ç¥ç»ç½‘ç»œä¸­ä½¿ç”¨
class LeakyReLUNet(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(LeakyReLUNet, self).__init__()
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(10, 50)
        self.leaky_relu = nn.LeakyReLU(negative_slope=0.01)
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(50, 1)
    
    def forward(self, x):
        x = self.fc1(x)
        x = self.leaky_relu(x)
        x = self.fc2(x)
        return x

# 4. PReLUï¼ˆå¯å­¦ä¹ çš„Leaky ReLUï¼‰
class PReLUNet(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(PReLUNet, self).__init__()
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(10, 50)
        self.prelu = nn.PReLU()  # å¯å­¦ä¹ çš„Î±
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(50, 1)
    
    def forward(self, x):
        x = self.fc1(x)
        x = self.prelu(x)
        x = self.fc2(x)
        return x

# 5. å¯¹æ¯”ReLUå’ŒLeaky ReLU
x = np.linspace(-3, 3, 100)
relu = np.maximum(0, x)
leaky = leaky_relu(x, alpha=0.01)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(x, relu, linewidth=2, label='ReLU')
plt.plot(x, leaky, linewidth=2, label='Leaky ReLU (Î±=0.01)', linestyle='--')
plt.axhline(y=0, color='k', linestyle='--', alpha=0.3)
plt.axvline(x=0, color='k', linestyle='--', alpha=0.3)
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('f(x)')
